content.raw: This function name has a mix of camel case and underscores. I understand it's because of the "supervisionLabel" name but reconsider creating a function for only setting a specific variable. I know previous examples used a function here but if it's a 3 liner that is only used once it might be best to just move it down here with a simple comment like "Create the supervision label's conditonal parents GMTK specification".
content.html: This function name has a mix of camel case and underscores. I understand it's because of the "supervisionLabel" name but reconsider creating a function for only setting a specific variable. I know previous examples used a function here but if it's a 3 liner that is only used once it might be best to just move it down here with a simple comment like "Create the supervision label's conditonal parents GMTK specification".

pull_request.title: Resolution option functionality for semi-supervised mode

update.description:
This pull request adds resolution>1 functionality for semisupervised mode by downsampling supervision label data to desired resolution by mode. Previously this was not implemented yet and only worked for resolution=1. 

Another question is if the gold standard for test/simplesemisupervised should be modified to accommodate for >1 resolution.
update.title: Resolution option functionality for semi-supervised mode

pull_request.title: Resolution option functionality for semi-supervised mode

update.description:
This pull request adds resolution>1 functionality for semisupervised mode by downsampling supervision label data to desired resolution. Previously this was not implemented yet and only worked for resolution=1. 

Importantly, the supervision_data must be typecasted to int32 in order to avoid unnecessary padding of values. If the type is the default int64, when the data is read back in 0's are padded between each 32 bit values by GMTK.

Another question is if the gold standard for test/simplesemisupervised should be modified to accommodate for >1 resolution.
update.title: Resolution option functionality for semi-supervised mode

pull_request.title: Resolution option functionality for semi-supervised mode

pullrequest.title: Resolution option functionality for semi-supervised mode

content.raw:
Is this better?

```
#!python
"""
Downsample an array to a desired resolution, by taking
the mode of each resolution-sized frame. For example, [1 2 2 3 4 4] 
downsampled to resolution 3 is: [2 4]
"""
```

It starts out as a numpy array.
content.html:
Is this better?

"""
Downsample an array to a desired resolution, by taking
the mode of each resolution-sized frame. For example, [1 2 2 3 4 4] 
downsampled to resolution 3 is: [2 4]
"""

It starts out as a numpy array.
